about.sendFeedbackDetail: You can send your valuable feedback to the GitHub issue.

row1.title: Ports
row1.subTitle: {{ports}}
row1.dialogSubTitle: Add ports of possible Pi server's ports, this will help to identify your Pi on the local network. (eg: 80 default, 32400 for plex, etc`)

row1.title: Scan Timeout
row1.subTitle: {{scanTimeoutInMs}} ms
row1.dialogSubTitle: Scan timeout per threads, ex: 150 threads per 1500 ms, If Pi server is not found try to increase the timeout.

row2.title: Scan Threads
row2.subTitle: {{scanThreads}}
row2.dialogSubTitle: Scan threads per timeouts,  ex: 150 threads per 1500 ms, If Pi server not found try to decrease threads.

row1.title: Media Playback Requires User Action
row1.subTitle: Boolean that determines whether HTML5 audio and video requires the user to tap them before they start playing. The default value is true. (Android API minimum version 17).

row2.title: Scales Page To Fit
row2.subTitle: Boolean that controls whether the web content is scaled to fit the view and enables the user to change the scale. The default value is true.

row3.title: Dom Storage Enabled
row3.subTitle: Boolean value to control whether DOM Storage is enabled. Used only in Android.

row4.title: Java Script Enabled
row4.subTitle: Boolean value to enable JavaScript in the WebView. The default value is true.

row5.title: Third Party Cookies Enabled
row5.subTitle: Boolean value to enable third-party cookies in the WebView. Used on Android Lollipop and above only as third-party cookies are enabled by default on Android Kitkat and below and iOS. The default value is true.

row6.title: User-Agent
row6.subTitle: Sets the user agent for the WebView.
row6.dialogSubTitle: The User-Agent (UA) string is contained in the HTTP headers and is intended to identify devices requesting online content.

row7.title: Allows full-screen Video
row7.subTitle: Boolean that determines whether videos are allowed to be played in full screen. The default value is false.

row8.title: Allows Inline Media Playback
row8.subTitle: Boolean that determines whether HTML5 videos play inline or use the native full-screen controller. The default value is false.

row9.title: Allows Air Play For Media Playback
row9.subTitle: A Boolean value indicating whether AirPlay is allowed. The default value is false.

row10.title: Bounces
row10.subTitle: Boolean value that determines whether the web view bounces when it reaches the edge of the content. The default value is true.

row11.title: Content Mode
row11.subTitle: Controls the type of content to load. Available on iOS 13 and later. Defaults to recommended, which loads mobile content on iPhone & iPad Mini but desktop content on larger iPads.

row12.title: Geolocation Enabled
row12.subTitle: Set whether Geolocation is enabled in the WebView. The default value is false. Used only in Android.

row13.title: Allow File Access From File Ur Ls
row13.subTitle: Boolean that sets whether JavaScript running in the context of a file scheme URL should be allowed to access content from other file scheme URLs. The default value is false.

row14.title: Allows Back Forward Navigation Gestures
row14.subTitle: If true, this will be able to horizontal swipe gestures. The default value is false.

row15.title: Pull To Refresh Enabled
row15.subTitle: Boolean value that determines whether a pull to refresh gesture is available in the WebView. The default value is false. If true, sets bounces automatically to true.

row17.title: Allows Protected Media
row17.subTitle: Whether or not the Webview can play media protected by DRM. Default is false.

row1.title: Clear WebView Data
row1.subTitle: Free up space by clearing all WebView data
row1.dialogSubTitle: Are you sure you want to clear webview data?

moreApps.apps1Desc: This application allows you to enable/disable ads or recommendations for various apps in Xiaomi (MIUI) devices.
moreApps.apps2Desc: An interactive way to learn Gujarati kakko, barakhadi and numbers.
moreApps.apps3Title: PiGo - Explore Your Pi Servers On the Go
moreApps.apps3Desc: PiGo - the open-source, free mobile companion for Raspberry Pi enthusiasts. Effortlessly explore and manage multiple Pi servers on the go.
moreApps.apps4Desc: `OHM-Client` is an unofficial open hardware monitor client app for Android and iOS written in react-native. Using this app you can monitor open hardware monitor web server.
